verses.verse: Six days before the Passover, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus was, the one who died whom he raised from the dead.
They made him supper there, and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with him.
Then Mary took a pound of very expensive, unadulterated oil of nard, anointed Jesus' feet, and wiped his feet with her hair. The fragrance of the perfumed oil filled the house.
Judas Iscariot, one of the disciples, the one who was going to betray him said,
"Why wasn't this perfumed oil sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?"
He didn't say this because he was concerned about the poor, but because he was a thief. He held the moneybag and took from it what was put into it.
Now then Jesus spoke, "Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of my burial.
"You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me."
A lot of people from the Jews soon afterward realized that he was there, and they came not only because of Jesus, but also that they might see Lazarus whom he had raised from the dead.
So the chief priests resolved that they should kill Lazarus also,
because many of the Jews were leaving [them] and were believing in Jesus because of him.
The next day many people, who were coming to the festival, heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem.
They took palm tree branches and went out to meet him shouting, "Hosanna! Blessed [is] he who comes in the name of the Lord, The King of Israel!"
Jesus found a young donkey and sat on him as it is written:
"Don't be afraid, daughter of Zion, Look! Here comes your King sitting on a donkey's colt."
At first his disciples didn't understand these things, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him and that they had done these things to him.
Therefore the people, who were with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave and raised him from the dead, kept telling it over and over.
For this reason the crowd also met him, because they heard that he had done this miracle.
As a result the Pharisees said among themselves, "Do you realize that we don't prevail at all? Look, the whole world is following him."
There were some Greeks among those who had come up to worship at the festival.
They went to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, "Sir, we want to see Jesus."
Philip came and told Andrew, and Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
Jesus answered them, saying, "The hour has come that the Son of Man should be glorified.
"Very truly, I say to you: Unless a kernel of wheat falls into the ground and die, it remains just one, but if it dies, it produces a lot of fruit.
"The one who loves his life will lose it, and the one who hates his life in this world will preserve it for eternal life.
"If anyone serves me, let him follow me. Where I am, there my servant will be, too. If any one serves me, the Father will honor him.
"Now my soul is troubled, and what can I say: Father save me from this hour? But the reason I came is for this hour.
"Father, glorify your name." Then a voice came from heaven, "I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again."
Therefore the people standing there and heard said, "It thundered," others said, "An angel spoke to him."
Jesus replied and said, "This voice didn't come for me but for you.
"Now is the judgment of this world; now the prince of this world will be thrown out.
"And if I, I, be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all to me."
He said this indicating what kind of death he was going to die.
The people answered him, "We understand from the Law that Christ remains forever. How come you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?"

Then Jesus said to them, "The light is with you only a little while longer. Walk while you have the light, lest darkness come upon you, for the one who walks in darkness does not know where he is going.
"While you have the light, believe in the light, so you may be the children of light." Jesus spoke these things, went away, and hid himself from them.
Even though he had done so many miracles in their presence, they still didn't believe in him,
So that Isaiah's statement might be fulfilled, which he spoke, "Lord, who has believed our message, and to whom has the arm of the Lord been displayed?"
That is why they were still not able to believe, because Isaiah again said,
"He has blinded their eyes and hardened their heart, so that they could not see with the eyes or understand with the heart and return [to me], and I would heal them."
These things Isaiah said when he saw his glory and spoke about him.
Nevertheless even of the leaders many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees, they did not confess, lest they should be thrown out of the synagogue,
for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
But Jesus shouted and said, "The one who believes in me, doesn't just believe in me but in the one who sent me,
And the one who sees me sees the one who sent me.
"I have come as a light into the world, that any who believes in me might not remain in darkness.
"And if anyone hears my words but doesn't believe, I do not judge him, because I didn't come to judge the world but to save the world.
"The one who rejects me and doesn't receive my words has one judging him--the word, which I spoke, will judge him on the last day.
"For I didn't speak of myself, but the Father, who sent me, gave me a commandment what I might say and speak.
"I know that his commandment is everlasting life. So then whatever I speak, I speak just what my Father told me."
